intro: Webera curvata, commonly known as the curly willow, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its long, cascading stems that often bend and curve, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow or greenish, appearing in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
